description.narrative: Increased awareness and commitment by key decision makers, informants, opinion leaders and the general public to promote positive social norms, innovative approaches and action in the best interests of the child. Align with SDG agenda and ensure children are high on the policy agenda., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, country and government leaders, policymakers and decision-makers and other key stakeholders across society utilize robust knowledge and evidence to inform the development of equitable policies, programmes, public communication and advocacy to improve the situation of the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children and women.

sector.narrative: Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Integrated advocacy initiatives leveraged media partnerships, social media engagement and celebrity partners to reach millions with key advocacy messages, including a focus on child rights, maternal, newborn and child health, and child online safety and education amongst others. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2021

title.narrative: Number of people reached through UNICEF platforms (social media, website and traditional media) to raise awareness and promote children(45307)

actual.value: 2020:5.7 million - including about 3.5 million followers (cumulative) across 11 social media channels (Weibo, WeChat, Douyin, Miaopai, Yizhibo, Youku, Toutiao, Himalaya FM, Kuaishou, Xinhuanet and Bilibili) and 2.2 million unique visitors to the website.
